metadata.source: Gyaltsen Namdrol: Pratityasamutpadahrdaya and Aryadharmadhatugarbhavivarana. Sarnath : CIHTS 1997, p. 29

children.translated_text: The twelve specific limbs, as declared by the sage, are arisen from <s>Pratītyasamutpāda</s> (dependent origination),
they are gathered into three: afflictions, actions, and suffering appropriately.

children.text: ādyāṣṭamanavamāḥ syuḥ kleśāḥ karma dvitīyadaśamau ca /
children.translated_text: The first, eighth, and ninth are afflictions; the second and tenth are actions,

children.text: śeṣāḥ sapta ca duḥkhaṃ trisaṅgrahā dvādaśa tu dharmāḥ // Pshk_2 //
children.translated_text: the remaining seven are suffering; thus the twelve are gathered into three categories.

children.text: tribhyo bhavati dvandvaṃ dvandvātprabhavanti sapta saptabhyaḥ /
children.translated_text: From the three arises duality; from duality arise seven, from the seven,

children.text: traya udbhavanti bhūyastadeva[tu] bhramati bhavacakram // Pshk_3 //
children.translated_text: three arise again; thus revolves the wheel of becoming.
Cause and effect indeed are all; there is no other being here in the world,

children.text: śūnyebhya eva śūnyā dharmāḥ prabhavanti dharmebhyaḥ // Pshk_4 //
children.translated_text: from emptiness alone do empty phenomena arise from phenomena.
With the lamp of self-study, the <s>mudrā</s> of the mirror's sound, using the seeds of the sun's radiance,
the conjunction and transition of the aggregates should be understood by the wise.
He who imagines annihilation even in the subtlest of entities,
does not see the meaning of dependent origination, being ignorant.
Nothing is to be removed from this, nor is anything to be added,

children.text: draṣṭavyaṃ bhūtato bhūtaṃ bhūtadarśī vimucyate // Pshk_7 //
children.translated_text: one should see the real as it is; the seer of reality is liberated.
